title: Peer-Supported Training Program for Strengthening Public Health Literature Search Competencies

context.prior_knowledge: Basic information retrieval skills and understanding of fundamental public health concepts
context.additional_context: Participants are public health literature search novices (new librarians/researchers) who must acquire practical skills for handling complex search requirements

learning_goals: Learners can independently conduct literature searches in core public health databases and information sources.
Through peer feedback and collaborative learning, search strategies can be improved by over 80%.
Learners can design and execute systematic searches on complex public health topics.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
